statement.text: The elementary charge e = 1.602176634 × 10⁻¹⁹ C is the smallest FREE electric charge in nature—all observable charges are integer multiples of e. Quarks carry fractional charges (±1/3e, ±2/3e) but are confined and never observed free. Single-electron transistors (SETs) detect charge changes of ~10⁻⁶ e. The Planck charge (qₚ = √(4πε₀ℏc) ≈ 1.88 × 10⁻¹⁸ C ≈ 11.7e) is NOT minimum—it's ~12 times larger than e.
statement.formal: Elementary charge: e = 1.602176634 × 10⁻¹⁹ C (exact by SI definition); Quark charges: ±e/3, ±2e/3; SET sensitivity: ~10⁻⁶ e

explanation.intuition: Electric charge is quantized—it comes only in integer multiples of e for free particles. This was demonstrated by Millikan's oil drop experiment. Quarks have fractional charges (1/3 or 2/3 of e) but are permanently confined within hadrons by the strong force. The Planck charge is NOT a minimum—it's about 12 times LARGER than the electron charge.
explanation.key_insight: Charge quantization is one of the deepest mysteries in physics—why does e have the value it does? Grand unified theories predict charge quantization from magnetic monopoles. SETs can resolve charge to ~10⁻⁶ e, but this is measuring partial redistribution of continuous charge in a capacitor, not fractional elementary charges.
explanation.technical_details: The elementary charge became exact in 2019 SI: e = 1.602176634 × 10⁻¹⁹ C. This defines the ampere as e/(1 s) × (frequency). Single-electron transistors use Coulomb blockade to detect single-electron tunneling. Searches for free fractional charges (±e/3) have found none, confirming quark confinement.

comparison_with_planck.interpretation: Planck charge is √137 times LARGER than e. It's not a minimum—it's the charge where electromagnetic coupling is order unity.

charge_quantization.observation: All free charges are integer multiples of e
charge_quantization.explanation_attempt: Dirac: Existence of magnetic monopoles would require charge quantization
charge_quantization.gut_prediction: Grand unified theories predict e/g = 2πn/ħ for monopole charge g

fractional_charges.confinement: QCD requires quarks remain in color-neutral combinations
fractional_charges.search_results: No free fractional charges found in matter

Current = charge/time; single electron sets minimum

learning_objectives: Understand that e is the smallest free charge
Know that Planck charge is LARGER than e (by √137)

common_misconceptions: Planck charge is NOT minimum—it's 11.7× larger than e
Quarks have fractional charges but cannot exist free
SET 'fractional charge' detection is capacitor redistribution, not fundamental
